reasoning: Autoimmune thyroiditis (Hashimoto's disease) is a chronic condition best measured by prevalence, not incidence. Global prevalence estimated at approximately 1% (10,000 per 100k population), based on population-based studies. Prevalence varies geographically from 0.5% in iodine-deficient regions to 2-3% in iodine-sufficient areas.
source: Chiovato L et al. (2012). Hypothyroidism in context: where we've been and where we're going. Adv Ther. 29(12):1081-1100
